conclusion: Two particles, A and B, start from rest and move in the same direction. The v-t graph shows their motion.
The graph shows Particle A accelerates to max velocity at \( t_0 \) and decelerates to rest at \( 2t_0 \). Particle B accelerates to max velocity at \( t_0 \) and decelerates to rest at \( 6t_0 \).
To find when A and B are farthest apart, identify when their position difference is maximized.
Particle A reaches max velocity at \( t_0 \) and returns to rest at \( 2t_0 \).
Particle B reaches max velocity at \( t_0 \) and returns to rest at \( 6t_0 \).
Max distance occurs when A is at max velocity and B is at rest, which is at \( t_0 \).
The time when A and B are the farthest apart is \( t_0 \).
